meanings.sent1: He fobbed his friend by pretending to find a rare coin for him.
meanings.sent2: She fobbed the salesman by saying she already had the product.
meanings.sent3: The magician fobbed the audience with his clever tricks.
meanings.sent4: The con artist fobbed the old lady out of her life savings.
meanings.sent5: The sly fox fobbed the rabbit into thinking he was a friend.

meanings.definition: to avoid doing something by making excuses
meanings.sent1: She fobbed off her chores by saying she had a headache.
meanings.sent2: He fobbed off the responsibility onto his younger sibling.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to fob off his homework on the dog.
meanings.sent4: The employee fobbed off the task to his colleague.
meanings.sent5: The child fobbed off bedtime by asking for one more story.
